column1: '''Iglishmêk''' was a [[Dwarves|Dwarvish]] language of silent gesture-signs.<ref>{{WJ|Quendi}}
*"I am listening" = slight raising of right-hand forefinger
column2: followed by a similar raising of the left-hand forefinger.<ref name=VT39/>

column1: *"Listen!" = slight raising of both forefingers simultaneously.<ref name=VT39/>

[[Magnus Åberg]] has theorized that the word ''iglishmêk'' is composed of *''<nowiki>'</nowiki>igal'' *"language" (as in ''aglâb'') and *''shimak'' *"gesture".<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Magnus Åberg]]|articleurl=http://www.forodrim.org/daeron/md_khuzdul.html|articlename=An analysis of Dwarvish|dated=|website=Forod|accessed=1 April 2012}}</ref>
